From the TestingLowerBounds project.
Co-authored-by: Lorenzo Luccioli

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [f59cd7bbbc](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21053/commits/f59cd7bbbc5a40d0d079084ecca1b84cd5beeb4a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.InformationTheory.KullbackLeibler.Basic` (new file)|2112|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ integral_llr_add_mul_log_nonneg`
`+ integral_llr_add_sub_measure_univ_nonneg`
`+ klDiv_eq_integral_klFun`
`+ klDiv_eq_lintegral_klFun`
`+ klDiv_eq_top_iff`
`+ klDiv_eq_zero_iff`
`+ klDiv_ne_top_iff`
`+ klDiv_of_ac_of_integrable`
`+ klDiv_of_not_ac`
`+ klDiv_of_not_integrable`
`+ klDiv_self`
`+ klDiv_zero_left`
`+ klDiv_zero_right`
`+ mul_klFun_le_toReal_klDiv`
`+ mul_log_le_klDiv`
`+ mul_log_le_toReal_klDiv`
`+ toReal_klDiv`
`+ toReal_klDiv_eq_integral_klFun`
`+ toReal_klDiv_of_measure_eq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21063~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21092~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21093~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21901~~

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks!
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by EtienneC30.

:v: RemyDegenne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the reviews!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13629539878/job/38094081193)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13629539878/job/38094080821)
That's great, thanks!

bors d+
Thanks!

You can put the `simp` in the `rw` here.
```suggestion
  Â· rw [â† not_iff_not, ne_eq, Decidable.not_not] at h_int_iff
```
Can't you drop the absolute continuity assumption as well here? If $\mu$ is not absolutely continuous with respect to $\nu$, then their `rnDeriv` is 0, so the `llr` is also 0?

`rnDeriv Î¼ Î½` is defined only `Î½`-a.e. . Suppose the two measures are supported on two disjoint sets, Âµ on A and Î½ on B. Then on B the rnDeriv is 0, but on A we don't know anything: it's an arbitrary function. Same for the llr, hence the kl may be infinite (by definition) but the llr could be any integrable function with arbitrary integral, since we integrate with respect to Âµ.

Sor sigma-finite measures, it's possible to make a choice of Radon-Nikodym derivative that would be defined `Âµ + Î½`-a.e.
But that's not our current definition of `rnDeriv`. That choice would be `Âµ.rnDeriv (Âµ + Î½) / Î½.rnDeriv (Âµ + Î½)`. I think it requires a sigma-finite assumption to have good properties though (from memory: I don't recall exactly why, but I tried it and there was that issue).
Using that better R-N derivative in Mathlib is something I want to investigate.

The `h_eq` in the `simp` does not do anything.
```suggestion
  Â· rw [kl_of_not_integrable h_int, integral_undef h_int, ENNReal.top_toReal]
```
Can't you drop integrability here as well?

Parentheses are not needed, as you prefer.
```suggestion
  exact integral_nonneg fun _ â†¦ klFun_nonneg ENNReal.toReal_nonneg
```

This `simp` can go in the `rw`.
```suggestion
  rw [kl_eq_lintegral_klFun, if_pos h_ne.1, lintegral_eq_zero_iff (by fun_prop)] at h
```

Maybe
```suggestion
noncomputable irreducible_def kl (Î¼ Î½ : Measure Î±) : â„â‰¥0âˆž :=
```
as the definition is a little bit complicated and one should never want the kernel to unfold it.
Isn't `kl` a  little bit too cryptic, even if it's in the `InformationTheory` namespace? `kldiv` isn't much longer, and maybe easier to interpret. Your choice.
`kldiv` or `klDiv`? I am unsure about the naming convention here.

I think the naming convention is `kldiv` (if a name would start with a sequence of capitals, lower case all of them). But you already have `klFun` (and I didn't complain at the time), so I'd say `klDiv` would also be fine: morally, it's `KlDiv`, and you lower case the `k`. For coherence with `klFun`, I'd say `klDiv`.

I think it should be `klDiv`. The extended name would be`kullbackLeiblerDivergence`, and `kullbackLeibler` is shortened to a one-block `kl`, but `Div` is another block so there should be an uppercase.
Ah when I wrote SÃ©bastien's message was not displayed to me. Anyway I agree on the conclusion.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(InformationTheory): define the Kullback-Leibler divergence between two finite measures
